channel.title: [C4D]Random scene
channel.description:
Im trying to be able to make small simple things and have them look real, since i got a new laptop and just recently installed c4d i thought i'd make something.
The gun wasn't supposed to look real, it was really just a simple model to see if i could make one from just a side view picture.
[img]http://img505.imageshack.us/img505/3337/randommf4.png[/img]
[img]http://img514.imageshack.us/img514/4596/gunrandomll6.png[/img]
[img]http://img526.imageshack.us/img526/3406/cod4randombm3.png[/img]

item.title: [C4D]Random scene
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Well there are PLENTYY of good hires M4 blueprints.

Good luck with it

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D]Random scene
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:7, topic:228724”]I know it’s not supposed to look real, but why not?

If you want to see if you can model from a side view, see if you can model the ENTIRE thing piece by piece.

Otherwise, you’re not learning anything.[/quote]
I usually model things with a front and side view, the M4 blueprint was only from the right so i had to kind of ‘eye’ the thickness. And by time i got the shape i had done everything differently that i couldn’t really add many things. Im going to make another one and start off with detail and go with it.

I really had no intent of even making the thing look as detailed as it is, i just made the outline to see if i could, then got bored and started to add a few things.

And i couldn’t find any big side views, so i couldn’t see what things were on the side, and when i zoomed they got blurry.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D]Random scene
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

I know it’s not supposed to look real, but why not?

If you want to see if you can model from a side view, see if you can model the ENTIRE thing piece by piece.

Otherwise, you’re not learning anything.

Read full topic
